required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioequivalence Study of Clorazepate Dipotassium 15mg Tablets Under Fasting Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: The Objective of This Study Was to Compare the Single-Dose Relative Bioavailability of Ranbaxy and Abbott (Tranxene® T-Tab®) 15 mg Clorazepate Dipotassium Tablets Under Fasting Conditions.

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study was to compare the single-dose relative bioavailability of Ranbaxy and Abbott (TranxeneeT-Tab®) 15 mg clorazepate dipotassium tablets under fasting conditions.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was conducted as an open label, balanced, randomised, two-treatment, two-period, two-sequence, single-dose, crossover , bioequivalence study on clorazepate dipotassium comparing clorazepate dipotassium 15mg tablets of Ranbaxy Laboratories with Abbott (TranxeneeT-Tab®) 15 mg, in healthy, adult, human, subjects under fasting conditions. A total of 32 subjects, 25 males and 7 females, were enrolled in the study, and 31 subjects, 24 males and 7 females, completed the study.

arm_group.description: 15 mg clorazepate dipotassium tablets of ranbaxy
